Package fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine

Class State

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine.State
All Implemented Interfaces:
fr.ens.biologie.generic.Sealable
public final class State extends Object implements fr.ens.biologie.generic.Sealable
A discrete state characteristic of a state machine.

Shayne Flint - 2012 refactored by J. Gignoux - Aug. 2019

  • Constructor Details

    • State

      public State​(String name, Procedure procedure)

      States must be created before transitions, then transitions are added through the addTransition(...) method.

      When entering a state, an action may be required. It is represented here by the Procedure argument: every time this state is entered, the procedure will be executed.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of this state
      procedure - the action performed when entering this state

    • State

      public State​(String name)

      States must be created before transitions, then transitions are added through the addTransition(...) method.

      Use this constructor when no action is taken on entering the state.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of this state

  • Method Details

    • addTransition

      public void addTransition​(Transition transition)

      Add a transition to another state.

      1. Transitions can only be added while this instance is unsealed (cf. the Sealable class). A call to the seal() method will secure this instance by preventing further addition of any other transition.
      2. All transitions must be triggered by a different Event. The seal() method will check for this condition and throw an Exception if it is false.
      Parameters:
      transition - The Transition to add.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the state name

    • getProcedure

      public Procedure getProcedure()
      Returns:
      the procedure exectued when entering this state

    • getTransitions

      public List<Transition> getTransitions()
      Returns:
      the list of all transitions from this state to other states

    • isQuiescent

      public boolean isQuiescent()
      A state is quiescent when it has no transitions to any other state, i.e. when it is a final state: there is no way to leave it.
      Returns:
      true if this state is quiescent
